compaction_summary.task: Synthesize Project Argos legal due diligence memorandum for $1.8B acquisition of Pinnacle Investment Management
compaction_summary.progress: 182,725/70,000 words (261% of target), 12/12 sections complete, 772 footnotes integrated
compaction_summary.next_action: COMPLETE - Document ready for quality-assessment-diagnostic phase
critical_context: Key person risk: Founder/CIO age 62, no successor, $112M weighted exposure
PM concentration: 8 PMs manage 83% AUM ($35B), $73.2M weighted exposure
Perpetual liabilities: Performance fee HWM $95M + MFN $45M NPV = $140M
Aggregate exposure: $318.1M gross, $85.4M weighted (4.7% of $1.8B deal)

on_resume: Check word count matches state file metrics

decisions_made.decision: Used Bash cat >> strategy for all section appends due to file size limitations
decisions_made.reason: Section-IV-A (100KB) and Section-IV-B (105KB) exceeded 25K Read token limit; Bash append bypasses limit entirely

decisions_made.decision: Wrote original Introduction section (Section II) with 5 subsections
decisions_made.reason: Introduction not provided in input files; synthesized from research-plan.md, fact-registry.md, and section reports
Dual-layer input access (section reports + specialist reports) enabled writing specific cross-references with case citations and dollar amounts

decisions_made.decision: Created comprehensive Cross-Reference Matrix (Section V) with 12 major cross-domain connections
decisions_made.reason: Demonstrates compounding risks (key person → private funds → contracts → valuation) and cascade effects

decisions_made.decision: Generated three scenario analyses (P10/P50/P90) with distribution methodology
decisions_made.reason: Enables Board to understand tail risk exposure; P50 $85.4M forms basis for escrow/price adjustment recommendations

decisions_made.decision: Wrote actionable Conclusion section with tiered negotiation strategy
decisions_made.reason: Provides Board with clear decision framework: Tier 1 (walk-away if not achieved), Tier 2 (negotiate aggressively), Tier 3 (accept compromise)

key_findings: PROCEED recommendation with $80M price reduction + $130M escrow
Top 3 risks: Key person $112M, PM concentration $73.2M, HWM $95M

II_introduction.source: Original content synthesized from research-plan.md and fact-registry.md

III_questions_presented.source: Original content synthesized from research-plan.md Questions Presented section

IV_detailed_legal_analysis.source: 12 section reports appended via Bash (section-IV-A through section-IV-L)
subsections: IV.A Investment Advisers Act Compliance (25,000 words)
IV.B Investment Company Act Compliance (26,000 words)
IV.H Employment and Key Person Risk (18,000 words)

V_cross_reference_matrix.source: Original content synthesizing connections across all 12 sections
key_cascades: Key Person → Private Funds → Contracts → Valuation (4-way cascade)
SEC Exam → Advisers Act → ERISA → Marketing Rule (regulatory concentration)
Insurance Gaps → Cyber → Valuation → 1940 Act (uninsured exposures)

VI_scenario_analysis.source: Original content using risk-summary.json data with probability distributions
VI_scenario_analysis.methodology: Distribution analysis using regulatory precedent, industry benchmarks, actuarial data

VII_conclusion_recommendations.source: Original content synthesizing all findings into actionable Board recommendations
VII_conclusion_recommendations.recommendation: PROCEED with mandatory retention agreements, $80M price reduction, $130M escrow, insurance procurement

appendices.source: Original content documenting limitations, assumptions, methodology
contents: Appendix B: Research Methodology and Sources

recovery_instructions.on_compaction: Read synthesis-state.json first. Document is COMPLETE. No further synthesis required. Proceed to quality-assessment-diagnostic phase.
